rounds.category: THE KEY WORD IN THE LITERARY SUBTITLE
rounds.comments: (Ken: You'll need to give us the title of the work.)

clues.text:
Colorful in 1877:
"Horse"

An 1854 series of essays:
"Woods"

A Vonnegut novel much about mortality:
"Death"

Challenging to pre-Civil War Americans:
"Lowly"

Evelyn Waugh, re-evaluated... wait, that's not the right word:
"Ryder"
This brand that "takes a licking & keeps on ticking" reset its slogan in 2021 to "we don't stop"
This city recently updated its slogan to "What happens here, only happens here"
Power up with this brand that today says it's "still going!"
The name of this baked cracker brand completes its slogan "Want it. Need it..."
Capital One asks this 4-word question
Poet Robert stops by the woods on a snowy evening to chomp on a synonym for chomp & develops this chilly condition
An auto picks up golfer Nicklaus to become this crime
To bound or leap drinks Macallan to play this kids' playground game
A set of squares like our game board adds a fastener to get nothing done politically
A harbor for a ship docks with a loose coat or robe to be this type of word, like spork or mockumentary
Author Ira Levin claimed credit for first suggesting Mia Farrow as the lead in this 1968 adaptation of his horror novel
That pesky Pazuzu sure causes some head turning in a film franchise based on this 1971 novel by William Peter Blatty
Both this 2002 Naomi Watts film & the 1991 Japanese novel on which it is based are firm arguments for streaming over VHS
Daphne du Maurier penned this tale of gulls gone wild that later became an Alfred Hitchcock film
"The Turning" is a 2020 film adaptation of an 1898 supernatural story by this author
The Hawaiians who developed this dance to honor gods or chiefs never thought there'd be a special Aulani version
The name tells you this is the country to visit in order to perfect your funk carioca
Emerging from Pashtun tribes, the attan is the national dance of this country & involves encircling a drummer
A sirtaki features in the movie about this life-loving Greek, who teaches the proper Brit Basil to dance it on the beach
English Morris dancing has a form named for this area of rolling hills & lovely towns like Tetbury & Tewkesbury
This fourth state of matter occurs when atoms in a gas are ionized
A key to quantum mechanics is the notion that both radiation & matter can act as either particles or these
Most snapping turtles are this type of equal-opportunity eater, happy to eat any old animal or vegetable for brunch
Chloroplasts are where this energy conversion process takes place in plants
This 12-letter word describes the richness of life forms in a given environment
A tossed beanbag that has run afoul of the rules is deemed a stanker in this pastime
Scott Salvadore won the "mane event" for the championships of this hairstyle with his 'do named "The Lord's Drapes"
In 2023 Post Malone paid big bucks for a card from this enduring card game that featured the One Ring from "The Lord of the Rings"
"Baldur's Gate 3" is a 2023 video game juggernaut based on the 5E rules for this tabletop role-playing game
In this centuries-old game with a hyphenated name, you throw a knife at your opponent's feet; what could go wrong?
When it comes to this potent potable, go for one labeled "100% blue agave"
An in-escape-able song by Rupert Holmes wonders if you like these cocktails & getting caught in the rain
This golfer has his name on the drink of iced tea & lemonade; spike it with vodka & you've got a John Daly
Though quite sweet, the name of this almond-flavored liqueur means "little bitter"
Many a classic cocktail calls for a wee bit o' this Scotch whisky liqueur flavored with heather honey
Ending in -ee, this interjection expresses delight; the -ie version was a member of the Youth International Party
Also starting & ending with H, this exultant cry was greatly used on Hulu's "The Great"
dictionary.com has 3 consecutive A's in this slang word, but you can draw it out even more before queen if you want to really show elation
American music fans best know the band Blur for their song that starts with this shriek of triumph
As an interjection, it means freakin' awesome, dude! As a noun, a less freakin' awesome unit of scientific measurement
It's a tchotchke or doodad, perhaps the "Virginia is for lovers" key chain picked up on a vacation
According to National Geographic, the world's largest man-made one by surface area is Lake Volta in Ghana
Gurez & Changthangi are sheep breeds from this disputed place on the Indian subcontinent
This word for a slaughterhouse is borrowed from French
This word can refer to a pirate in the Mediterranean Sea from the 16th to 19th century
Total degrees in a circle divided by justices on the U.S. Supreme Court
Traditional number of Hercules' labors times books in the Pentateuch
ML in Roman numerals minus Douglas Adams' answer to "life, the universe and everything"
Number of U.S. states in 1958 divided by the number of our solar system's planets after Pluto's demotion
Forbes' annual wealthiest Americans minus Fortune's annual biggest U.S. companies by revenue
Waking up in "Planes, Trains and Automobiles", Steve realizes the hand of this late, great actor is not between 2 pillows
In 2021 Mr. Steve Martin co-created this Hulu series where New Yorkers are just droppin' like flies
This title Daryl Hannah character says to Steve, "You have a big nose! You have a beautiful, great, big, flesh-&-bone nose!"
OK, so it's complicated--in "It's Complicated", Steve's co-star was this man, also Steve's co-host for the Oscars
After Steve asks Lily Tomlin why she thinks she'll come back from the dead in this 1984 film, Lily replies, "Because I'm rich"

rounds.text: In 1896 he wrote, "My prices are 2000, 3000 & 4000 dollars for head & shoulders, 3/4 length & full-length respectively"
